intro: Cyclamen albidum, commonly known as the white cyclamen, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and thrives in cool, moist environments. Cyclamen albidum prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and long-lasting blooms.
